result.execSummary:
The defendant Icyess A Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample by 11/3/2022.
Court ordered mandatory costs, fees and surcharges. To be paid by 5/1/2023.  If the defendant fails to pay all costs and surcharges a civil judgment shall be entered.
Court waives all nonmandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.

Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of sentence and verification of 20 hours of completed community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Icyess A Chapman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Icyess A Chapman in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Icyess A Chapman.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea/Sentencing hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction; with credit for 2 DAYS served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

- Court ordered mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid by 05/01/2023.  If the defendant fails to pay all costs and surcharges, a civil judgement shall be entered. 
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Provide DNA Sample by 11/03/2022.
- Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of sentence and verification of 20 hours of completed community service.  

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Icyess A Chapman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the State. Defense further requests a PGP date. No objections from the state. Case is adjourned for a Plea/ Sentencing date to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Icyess A Chapman in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Joseph Domask appeared by video means. Defense still needs discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Icyess A Chapman in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 16 for a Status Conference.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Case tabbed to Br 16 in error
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-21-2022 @1:30p
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on June 21st. 2022 @ 1:30pm.init
